data.title: If you like coffee
data.text: The coffee here is excellent. It's a little off the beaten path, but it's one of the three places in the South that I have visited that I would say has excellent coffee.

data.title: A great little place to enjoy coffee and relax
data.text:
We are evacuating from Bluffton SC
Found this place in a local where to go! We been hear twice. The coffee is roasted in house and the owner was super nice. We had pour overs A cinnamon buns and a ham and cheese roll.

data.title: Best in town, I guess
data.text: So this really seems like the best coffee in Augusta, however their roasts are vastly more dark than most small roaster/shops are doing these days. If this shop were in my hometown it would be about the 6th one down on my list. Morning glory muffin was very tasty

data.title: Great cafe
data.text: Recommended by our daughter while visiting Augusta.Fabulous drinks and baristas take great pride in their product.Area appears unlikely for a coffee shop-go anyway!

data.title: Fabulous Coffee
data.text: Being a coffee snob/purist, Buona is the ONLY espresso in the CSRA region that I've found I like. The morning barista knows his stuff. The owner/roaster is passionate, and the food is really nice. REAL coffee and a great vibe!

data.title: very good coffee and service
data.text: Went there on a tip from a co-worker and was quite pleased.  The pour over coffee was some of the best coffee that I've had.  My son got a vanilla iced coffee and I got the medium roast pour over.  The guy at the counter was very helpful and I really enjoyed the service and coffee.  Not an everyday thing, but I plan on going at least once a week.

data.title: Great retreat
data.text: Very friendly, comfortable place to park and do business, read, or meet friends. Espresso drinks done well and they roast their own coffee (which is powerful). Moms, students, business types congregate here throughout the day...can get busy enough to fight for a seat in afternoon, but mornings are great.   Homemade quiche is great; the coffee cake is also fantastic and dense.  Staff is welcoming.

data.title: Truly outstanding coffee shop
data.text: Somehow, the best coffee shop in the Southeast is in a tiny house on a random corner in Augusta, Georgia. Great service, knowledgable and expert while also friendly and laid back. Worth the trip.

data.title: That perfect cup of coffee
data.text: Best local coffee shop with friendly staff. They are very knowledgeable about their coffee and can tell you anything you'd like to know about it, from where it's from to the flavor profiles. The prices are unbeatable for the quality and I'd rather come here than that coffee chain with the mermaid! I'd suggest getting the pour over coffee, it brings out unbelievable flavors that anyone from a novice to a connoisseur will love!

data.title: Gem on central avenue
data.text: When I found out about this place, I was there every other day. I fell in love with the jasmine green tea as well as the stamp that came with its purchase. This is also a great place to sit and do some reading. This is one of the few things that I miss about living in Augusta.

data.title: Good coffee and pleasant rooms
data.text: Friends invited me to stop in and I'm so glad we did.  The coffee is exceptionally smooth and full of flavor.  The pastries/sweets are fresh and very good.  the staff is friendly and knowledgeable and there is variety of seating to fit your mood.  I've gone back a few times and the cafe is consistently welcoming and the coffee excellent.

data.title: Great coffee and atmosphere!
data.text: I'm not a coffee buff, but it was very tasty, the atmosphere was nice, and the staff were friendly.  The atmosphere feels akin to being in someone's home.

data.title: Nice place great coffee
data.text: Really good coffee.  Nice quiet place. Friendly staff.  Would go back again.  Must stop by if you're serious about coffee.  They roast, and sell beans too.  Food is good too!

data.title: Excellent Café, with a few reservations.
data.text: I really, really, really like the coffee here. It really is artisan, and it really shows in the taste. However, for me, a frequent café goer across town, the lack of power outlets and the price of the coffee is a bit steep and a bit off-putting for someone on a budget. Refills (as of July 17, 2015) require another whole cup's purchase, whereas other locales in town typically offer a discount on additional cups. Then again, if you want very good coffee, you won't go wrong here, it's more a matter of what you'll be willing to pay for.

data.title: Best coffee in Augusta
data.text: I love the coffee here, it is the place I go when I have free time to myself. The staff is wonderful and the environment great.

data.title: the very best coffee we have had in a long time
data.text:
We were on our way from Hilton Head, via Charleston to Atlanta when we stopped at this coffee place. We were served the best coffee (for my husband) and cappuccino (me) we've had in a very long time: rich, creamy, dark but not bitter. Just excellent! 
We had an oatmeal cookie and a chocolate chip cookie with our coffees and they were so yummy!
The service was equally good.
People were using their computers as there is free wireless internet.
I sometimes like to sit at Starbucks, because nobody cares how long I stay, but.... the coffee there is not that great.... At home we have various coffee makers, from simple to very top of the range elaborate but we haven't made coffees like this (yet)...
Buona Caffe would be MY place to hang out if I were living closer, for sure! An extra bonus: their prices compare to any other (far lesser) coffee shop, so why drink lesser coffee?

data.title: Excellent coffee and experience!
data.text:
I moved to nearby Aiken, SC about 6 months ago and since then I've become a regular and Buona Coffee. I buy one or two pounds of unground bean every week I'm in the area. 

The espresso roast is a very darkly-roasted (oily) blend of arabica beans. They have a variety of other medium- and dark-roasted, single origin coffees which are suitable for pour-overs, French press, or drip coffee. 

They have a good selection of house baked cakes and pastries that are also pretty good!

data.title: Never had better coffee in my life
data.text: I'm hesitant to even give a good review simply because the more people find out about this place the more crowded it will get. This place is a true gem. The coffee is top notch quality, good enough for even the snobbiest of coffee snobs. The lattes are also very good. I still prefer their daily specials on coffee though. My favorites so far are the medium Nicaraguan and the dark roast Ethiopian. I'm not one to normally like black coffee, but I prefer it black from Buona because of the high quality coffee you are getting. What's also great about this place is that they have knowledge of what they serve. They take pride in their craft of roasting their own beans, and do a great job! I can't say enough about how good this place is.

data.title: Lovely coffee and a testament to the city
data.text: Great coffee with so many different types available (cappuccino, espresso, americano, pour over and even bags to buy and take home). They also have selections of French and Italian sodas (Italian sodas are carbonated water with flavoured syrup and French is with syrup, carbonated water and half and half) with multiple flavours (like mocha, vanilla and cinnamon) great on a hot summer day. And the treats are to die for (my favourites are the brownies and the chocolate chip cookies) the staff is also excellent friendly and well mannered. In all if you are in Augusta you should drop by for a coffee in the morning or winter (or in the summer a soda )

data.title: Great Little place with Great Coffee
data.text: Excellent Coffee, Great Service and very nice people who own this place. took home two bags theEthiopian Sidamo Ard and Nicaraguan Matagalpa, Selva Negra Estate, can't wait to get home and try them.  Wish we had a place like this in California.
